main event: Two Air France pilots encountered a strange, bright, luminous cloud that obscured their visibility for 30 seconds while flying over the Rivera Area, France on October 7, 1952.
interesting points: The cloud was straight, level, and continuous, and it seemed to be stationary.
The object was estimated to be circular in shape, with a diameter of 5-6 meters, and was brilliantly luminous.
The pilots estimated the speed of the object to be 2-3 times the speed of an aircraft at full speed.
The pilots stated that there was nothing in common between the smooth running of their aircraft and the sudden and brief apparition of the luminous object.
After the incident, the pilots reported disturbances in their eyesight and were grounded from flying for a time.
witnesses: two Air France commercial airline pilots
